title: Drawing, "Design for Bed with Tented Alcove, probably for the Prince of Wales's Bedroom or Boudoir, Royal Pavilion, Brighton", ca. 1801–04
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on white wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Design for an alcove between two rooms, with a sofa upholstered in a fabric matching the flanking drapery curtains and the tented ceiling canopy.  Above the sofa, the wall is decorated with fluted golden drapery radiating from a convex, sun-shaped mirror.  Drapery frames the sofa recess and doorways.  The walls of the rooms on either side are turquoise.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Bed with Tented Alcove, probably for the Prince of Wales's Bedroom or Boudoir, Royal Pavilion, Brighton", ca. 1801–04.
ca. 1801–04. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-26.
